data.event: John Miles, the founder of the first Baptist Church in Wales, moved to Swansea in 1662/3.

event.title: 1667 the first Baptist church in Massachusetts relocated

data.event: In 1667 the first Baptist church in Massachusetts relocated to Swansea from Rehoboth after experiencing religious intolerance there, and Swansea was incorporated as an independent town.

event.title: June 20, 1675, the first Indian attack of King Philip's War had all 70 settlers confined

data.event: On June 20, 1675, the first Indian attack of King Philip's War had all 70 settlers confined to their stockade.

event.title: June 25 the entire town had been burned

data.event: By June 25 the entire town had been burned, although a handful of the colonists escaped to Taunton.
When the active war ended in 1676, the town was soon rebuilt.
